title: 1998 Suzuki Carry Pickup 4WD 5-Speed at No Reserve
description: This 1998 Suzuki Carry is a right-hand-drive kei pickup that was imported to the US from Japan, and it is powered by a 657cc inline-three mated to a five-speed manual transmission with an extra-low forward gear. The truck is finished in white and features a headache rack, a rear work light, fold-down bedsides, 12″ steel wheels, front disc brakes, air conditioning, and a radio. Acquired by the selling dealer in 2025, this DD51T Carry shows 44k kilometers (~27k miles) and is offered at no reserve with a clean Florida title.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a No Reserve: 1998 Suzuki Carry Pickup 4WD 5-Speed at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #178,450.
text: This 1998 Suzuki Carry is a right-hand-drive kei pickup that was imported to the US from Japan, and it is powered by a 657cc inline-three mated to a five-speed manual transmission with an extra-low forward gear. The truck is finished in white and features a headache rack, a rear work light, fold-down bedsides, 12″ steel wheels, front disc brakes, air conditioning, and a radio. Acquired by the selling dealer in 2025, this DD51T Carry shows 44k kilometers (~27k miles) and is offered at no reserve with a clean Florida title. The truck is finished in white and features a headache rack, a rear work light, fold-down bedsides, mud flaps, and front window rain guards. The 12″ steel wheels are mounted with Yokohama tires. Braking is handled by front discs and rear drums. The right-hand-drive cab features bucket seats upholstered in gray woven vinyl, and interior appointments include air conditioning, a radio, and rubber floor liners. The two-spoke steering wheel fronts a 120-km/h speedometer and gauges for fuel level and coolant temperature. The six-digit odometer shows 44k kilometers (~27k miles). The 657cc F6A inline-three can be accessed through a removable panel in the bed and via flip-up panels beneath the seats. Power is routed to the rear or all four wheels through a five-speed manual transmission with an extra-low forward gear. You are not connected to real-time updates. Attempting to connect. html:
This 1998 Suzuki Carry is a right-hand-drive kei pickup that was imported to the US from Japan, and it is powered by a 657cc inline-three mated to a five-speed manual transmission with an extra-low forward gear. The truck is finished in white and features a headache rack, a rear work light, fold-down bedsides, 12″ steel wheels, front disc brakes, air conditioning, and a radio. Acquired by the selling dealer in 2025, this DD51T Carry shows 44k kilometers (~27k miles) and is offered at no reserve with a clean Florida title.

The truck is finished in white and features a headache rack, a rear work light, fold-down bedsides, mud flaps, and front window rain guards.

The 12″ steel wheels are mounted with Yokohama tires. Braking is handled by front discs and rear drums.

The right-hand-drive cab features bucket seats upholstered in gray woven vinyl, and interior appointments include air conditioning, a radio, and rubber floor liners.

The two-spoke steering wheel fronts a 120-km/h speedometer and gauges for fuel level and coolant temperature. The six-digit odometer shows 44k kilometers (~27k miles).

The 657cc F6A inline-three can be accessed through a removable panel in the bed and via flip-up panels beneath the seats. Power is routed to the rear or all four wheels through a five-speed manual transmission with an extra-low forward gear.
